result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell Ross Barron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge

--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--No contact with Camren Parker, Tyler McGinnis
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

The Court orders no expungement on this case

Arresting Agency: UWWW

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF142 & 16CF30 called together at 2:40 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Mitchell Ross Barron in court with Attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

16CF30: Service of the Complaint Admitted; Reading Waived
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Barron  waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information
; Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Court reviews plea paperwork with Mr. Barron
off-record: 2:45  - 2:46 pm for Atty Eisenberg to confer with client
Court amends criminal case settlement by Its own hand to reflect agreement of parties that Defendant will plea to Ct#1 rather than Ct#3

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 and #3
Atty Eisenberg submits documents in support of Defendant

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--No contact with Camren Parker, Tyler McGinnis
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--Reimburse $75 drug testing fees

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
The Court orders no expungement on this case
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given

15CF142: The Court dismisses this case upon motion of the State.
Recess: 3:05 pm
